types.affluent towns: Affluent towns are more prosperous, typically have an older population and are less ethnically diverse than average. They are more likely to be found in rural areas.
types.coastal towns: Coastal towns are defined by their geography, they also  tend to have an older population than average.
types.ex-industrial towns: Ex-Industrial towns are towns whose traditional industries have disappeared. A greater proportion of people here work in manufacturing.
types.rural towns: Towns in rural areas that are less well off than affluent towns and do not have a coastline.
types.hub-and-spoke towns: Hub-and-spoke towns are comparatively urban towns that are often satellite towns of bigger cities, or are hub towns with their own satellites. These towns have higher levels of ethnic diversity.
